data.title: Pretty decent entertainment
data.text: For a city that is somewhat remote the presentation at the FM Opera are quite good.  And relatively inexpensive.

data.title: Great Local Opera
data.text: The F-M Opera has been a community mainstay for decades. They do two major operas each year and often bring in guest artists for lead roles. The local talent is quite good and the orchestra has really improved in recent years. They did Madama Butterfly in the fall of 2015 and it was heartbreakingly beautiful.

data.title: Very impressive opera, but poorly choreographed
data.text: World class opera singers in lead roles, outstanding staging, scenary, costuming, repertoire, and choice of venue. Compared to what you would pay for this quality in a big city the pricing is far less than I expected over the years. Good support staff and so on. My only complaint is with the choreography. They use the same choreographer year after year, show after show. He has no training in a number of the dances he is choreographing such as the Vieneese Waltz, sny type of folk or ethnic dancing, Latin dancing such as the Tango.  It is an embaressment to the quality of the rest of the productions. This opera company needs to be using a variety of choreographers who are well-trained in the type of dance they are choreogralphing.

data.title: Quite an accomplishment
data.text: Top quality singers, staging, costuming and orchestra.  Professional calibre productions in a place you might not expect. Worth a try if you've never been to an opera or if you've attended the best productions anywhere in the world.
